<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINTECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/15/revolut-800-million-funding-round-signifies-hot-fintech-market?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Join the Fintech Revolut-ion
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/15/revolut-800-million-funding-round-signifies-hot-fintech-market?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="iPhone with dollar sign apps" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81Nzg4L2ZpbnRlY2hfYXBwcy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fintech has become more popular than a white Telfar bag. After an $800 million funding round, Revolut, a London-based fintech startup, is now the UK's <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2021/07/15/revolut-confirms-a-fresh-800m-in-funding-at-a-33b-valuation-to-supercharge-its-financial-services-superapp/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest private company ever</a> with a valuation of $33 billion. It was worth just $5.5 billion last year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Revolut falls into the category of “neobanks,” which plug into traditional banking infrastructure and repackage it with a smooth, easy-to-navigate platform. Revolut allows users to bank, invest, transfer money, budget, or do anything else their financial heart desires.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Fintech investing > other kinds of investing</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When you say, “Invest in my new fintech startup,” investors say, “How much?” $1 out of every $5 raised globally last quarter went to the fintech industry for a total of <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/08/global-venture-funding-uses-momentum-2021s-first-quarter-hit-record-highs-second-quarter?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$33.7 billion</a>, per CB Insights. With Stripe and Klarna, fintech boasts two of the five most valuable unicorns in the world.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s also clear that Europe doesn’t need help from Ted Lasso to build world-beating fintechs. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Klarna, the Swedish buy-now-pay-later company responsible for the staggering amount of Girlfriend exercise dresses in your closet, snagged a $46 billion valuation last month. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Wise, a British money-transfer app, was the first tech company to go public on the London Stock Exchange via direct listing last week. The company was valued at $11 billion and its listing was a huge win for the burgeoning fintech industry the country has been </span><span><a href="https://fortune.com/2021/07/07/fintech-wise-public-london-stock-exchange-direct-listing/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">trying to birth</a></span><span> since Brexit.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Venture capitalists are betting that fintech companies, with their focus on digital and their potential to attract the legions of underbanked or unbanked people in the world, will successfully disrupt incumbent banks. </p>

</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Aurora</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Autonomous vehicle startup Aurora <a href="https://www.post-gazette.com/business/tech-news/2021/07/15/Aurora-to-go-public-SPAC-merger-Reinvent-Technology-Partners-Y-self-driving-technology/stories/202107150123?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> plans yesterday to go public via SPAC at a valuation of $11 billion. In doing so, it’ll become the first major company in this young industry to hit the markets. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How to describe Aurora? </strong>Well, imagine if the CEOs of the WSJ, the NYT, and the Economist all left to start Morning Brew. Aurora was founded in 2017 by three industry pioneers who led driverless tech initiatives at Google, Uber, and Tesla. In January, the company acquired Uber’s self-driving unit and now has 1,600 employees.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And what’s the game plan? </strong>Aurora is SPACing to raise money and commercialize its self-driving tech. It wants to hit the road with the Aurora Driver, a self-driving semi truck that could seriously upset kids trying to get truck drivers to honk their horns. Eventually, the company wants to get its tech into more vehicles, including ones that move humans.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>In the race to develop autonomous vehicles, there are no hares, only tortoises. The industry has taken a lot longer to grow up than most experts, even <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/7/5/22563751/tesla-elon-musk-full-self-driving-admission-autopilot-crash?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Elon Musk</a>, expected.</p>

EDUCATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/15/several-mba-programs-end-hybrid-learning-fall?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
MBA Students Go Back to School
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While some of us dread heading back to the office, our business school friends can’t wait to exchange biz cards at cocktail parties. Several prestigious MBA programs, including Columbia, NYU, and Stanford, are scrapping their <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/m-b-a-programs-from-stanford-to-columbia-and-nyu-pass-on-hybrid-learning-11626346800?mod=hp_listc_pos2" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hybrid learning models</a> and bringing students back to campus this fall, reports the WSJ.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>MBA programs across the country shifted to remote learning when Covid hit last spring. But because Zoom U can’t replicate networking off the Dalmatian Coast, students sued universities and asked for their money back. Harvard refunded $5 million in MBA tuition after canceling its global immersion courses due to Covid. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Kate Kirsch, an incoming Harvard MBA student, told the WSJ: “So much of the value of the MBA program is the people. Those spontaneous encounters are something that even the top-tier institutions cannot recreate virtually.” </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Despite the challenges posed by the pandemic (or maybe <em>because</em> of them?) applications to business schools rose 2.4% last year and demand is expected to stay strong for the next three-to-four years. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/15/key-performance-indicators-july-16?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

Key Performance Indicators

</h1>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/15/key-performance-indicators-july-16?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Image of US map linked by several computers" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MjgyL2R0Y19yZW1vdGVfd29ya2luZ19pbWFnZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>There are now <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/15/business/dealbook/soho-house-ipo.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more job listings</a> for remote roles that pay at least $100,000 than in any single city in North America, according to Ladders, a job site that advertises six-figure jobs. Around 15% of high-paying jobs are open to remote work, compared to 5% last year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> “After years of studying it, I believe that cryptocurrency is an inherently right-wing, hyper-capitalistic technology built primarily to amplify the wealth of its proponents through a combination of tax avoidance, diminished regulatory oversight, and artificially enforced scarcity.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Any guesses on who tweeted this? None other than Jackson Palmer, the inventor of dogecoin. In a <a href="https://twitter.com/ummjackson/status/1415353984617914370?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">thread</a> bashing the industry, Palmer called the crypto world a “cult-like ‘get rich quick’ funnel designed to extract new money from the financially desperate and naive.”</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This puzzle is for all the road-trippers out there: Take the postal abbreviations for four connected states and scramble them to make an eight-letter word. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For example, you can drive directly from South Dakota (SD) to Iowa (IA) to Missouri (MO) to Arkansas (AR). From the letters SD-IA-MO-AR you can form the word “dioramas.” Can you make other words from four-state combos?</p>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFintech has become more popular than a white Telfar bag. After an $800 million funding round, Revolut, a London-based fintech startup, is now the UK's \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2021/07/15/revolut-confirms-a-fresh-800m-in-funding-at-a-33b-valuation-to-supercharge-its-financial-services-superapp/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebiggest private company ever\u003c/a\u003e with a valuation of $33 billion. It was worth just $5.5 billion last year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRevolut falls into the category of “neobanks,” which plug into traditional banking infrastructure and repackage it with a smooth, easy-to-navigate platform. With Stripe and Klarna, fintech boasts two of the five most valuable unicorns in the world.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s also clear that Europe doesn’t need help from Ted Lasso to build world-beating fintechs. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eKlarna, the Swedish buy-now-pay-later company responsible for the staggering amount of Girlfriend exercise dresses in your closet, snagged a $46 billion valuation last month. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWise, a British money-transfer app, was the first tech company to go public on the London Stock Exchange via direct listing last week. solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etrying to birth\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e since Brexit.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile some of us dread heading back to the office, our business school friends can’t wait to exchange biz cards at cocktail parties. Several prestigious MBA programs, including Columbia, NYU, and Stanford, are scrapping their \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/m-b-a-programs-from-stanford-to-columbia-and-nyu-pass-on-hybrid-learning-11626346800?mod=hp_listc_pos2\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehybrid learning models\u003c/a\u003e and bringing students back to campus this fall, reports the WSJ.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eMBA programs across the country shifted to remote learning when Covid hit last spring. But because Zoom U can’t replicate networking off the Dalmatian Coast, students sued universities and asked for their money back. Harvard refunded $5 million in MBA tuition after canceling its global immersion courses due to Covid. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eKate Kirsch, an incoming Harvard MBA student, told the WSJ: “So much of the value of the MBA program is the people. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eDespite the challenges posed by the pandemic (or maybe
